typical_duration.note: Elective lap chole 1-2 days; acute cholecystitis may require longer

documentation_must_include: History of recurrent biliary colic episodes with frequency
Ultrasound report showing gallstones with size/number
Impact on daily activities/quality of life

clinical_criteria: USG showing gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid
documentation_must_include: Clinical triad: RUQ pain, fever, positive Murphy's sign

primary_indications.indication: Prophylactic cholecystectomy for asymptomatic gallstones - GEOGRAPHY SPECIFIC
clinical_criteria: Young healthy women from North/Northeast India (high GBC risk region)
Large stones >3cm OR calcified 'porcelain' gallbladder OR polyps >10mm
documentation_must_include: Patient location (North/Northeast India for cancer risk justification)
Stone size or gallbladder characteristics from USG
Age and gender (young women in high-risk regions)
primary_indications.note: CRITICAL: Geographic location matters. Prophylactic surgery NOT indicated for asymptomatic stones in South India without other risk factors

insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: Incidental USG finding of gallstones, no symptoms, patient from South India
insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Asymptomatic stones generally not surgical indication unless high cancer risk (North India geography) or other risk factors
insufficient_justifications.insurer_likely_response: Reject; surgery not medically necessary for asymptomatic stones in low-risk population

essential_elements.format: Number, size, location of stones; gallbladder wall thickness; CBD diameter
essential_elements.example: Multiple gallstones largest 1.2cm, GB wall 4mm, CBD 5mm
essential_elements.weak_if: No USG report or vague 'stones present' without details

essential_elements.format: Frequency of biliary colic episodes, severity, triggers
essential_elements.example: Recurrent RUQ pain x 6 episodes over 3 months, post-prandial, each lasting 2-4 hours, requiring ER visits x2
essential_elements.weak_if: No symptom history for claimed 'symptomatic' gallstones

essential_elements.example: Patient from Uttar Pradesh (high GBC risk region), young female age 32, asymptomatic 2cm stone - prophylactic surgery justified
essential_elements.weak_if: Prophylactic surgery claimed without geographic/risk factor justification

mandatory_preoperative.documentation: Stone count/size, GB wall thickness, CBD diameter
mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: Cannot confirm gallstone diagnosis without imaging

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Normal in chronic cholelithiasis; elevated if CBD stone
mandatory_preoperative.documentation: Bilirubin, ALT, AST, ALP, GGT values
mandatory_preoperative.note: Abnormal LFTs suggest CBD stone - may need ERCP before surgery

optional_situational.note: Needed if CBD stone suspected before surgery

when_indicated: Confirmed CBD stone needing removal before cholecystectomy
optional_situational.fwa_flag_if: Performed when both LFTs and USG are normal - unnecessary invasive test

unnecessary_tests.test: ERCP when LFTs and USG normal
unnecessary_tests.why_unnecessary: ERCP invasive with risks; only indicated if CBD stone evidence
unnecessary_tests.action: Reject ERCP charges if no clinical indication

cost_inflation_schemes.how_detected: Check patient geography, stone characteristics, symptoms
red_flag_indicators: Asymptomatic stones, patient from South India (low GBC risk)
No documented high-risk features (large stones, porcelain GB)
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Reject if not medically necessary per geographic/risk-based guidelines

cost_inflation_schemes.how_detected: Check LFTs and CBD diameter on USG
red_flag_indicators: ERCP performed when LFTs normal and CBD <6mm on USG
No clinical indication for invasive biliary intervention
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Reject ERCP charges if no documented CBD pathology

cost_inflation_schemes.pattern: High conversion rate to open surgery
red_flag_indicators: Pattern of billing higher open procedure rates
cost_inflation_schemes.clinical_context: While conversion is legitimate safety measure, consistently high rate may indicate inadequate laparoscopic skills or billing manipulation
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Approve conversion if documented difficulty; flag provider for audit if pattern persists

medical_negligence_considerations.issue: Bile duct injury during laparoscopic cholecystectomy
medical_negligence_considerations.incidence: Higher in lap vs open cholecystectomy
medical_negligence_considerations.context: Common cause of medical negligence litigation in India
medical_negligence_considerations.validation_approach: If claim includes follow-up bile duct repair surgery, flag original cholecystectomy claim for review

intraoperative.note: Serious complication requiring specialist hepatobiliary surgeon

postoperative.management: ERCP with stenting or percutaneous drainage

waiting_periods.acute_cholecystitis: May be covered as emergency after initial waiting period
waiting_periods.note: Long waiting period for elective cholecystectomy in most policies

geographic_considerations.validation_rule: Prophylactic cholecystectomy in young women from these regions may be justified even if asymptomatic
geographic_considerations.validation_rule_low_risk: Asymptomatic stones generally NOT surgical indication without other risk factors

contextual_notes_for_llm.medical_reasoning_guidance: Cholecystectomy necessity depends on THREE factors: (1) Symptoms (recurrent biliary colic), (2) Complications (acute cholecystitis, pancreatitis), OR (3) Cancer risk (geography + demographics). North India has world's highest gallbladder cancer rates, making prophylactic surgery reasonable in young women. South India low-risk, so asymptomatic stones NOT surgical.
contextual_notes_for_llm.geographic_intelligence: This is UNIQUE to Indian context. Validation system MUST have geographic rules. Patient from Uttar Pradesh with asymptomatic stones = consider approving. Same patient from Kerala = likely reject as unnecessary. This geographic nuance is evidence-based (GBC epidemiology studies) and critical for fair adjudication.
common_pitfalls: Don't reject all asymptomatic gallstone surgeries - check geography first
ERCP is invasive with risks - only approve if LFTs abnormal or CBD dilated
Conversion to open surgery is legitimate if documented difficulty, but watch for patterns
